what: Calculate Counts and Percentages of Factor Levels — count_percent
title: Calculate Counts and Percentages of Factor Levels — count_percent
text: function computes counts percentages level factor categorical variable. returns character vector level's count percentage total, formatted specified number decimal places.

title: Calculate Counts and Percentages of Factor Levels — count_percent
Calculate Counts and Percentages of Factor Levels — count_percent
text: x factor categorical variable. digits integer indicating number decimal places percentages rounded. Defaults 2.

title: Calculate Counts and Percentages of Factor Levels — count_percent
text: character vector element corresponds level x. element formatted 'count (percentage%)', 'count' number occurrences level 'percentage' percentage total, rounded digits decimal places.

title: Calculate Counts and Percentages of Factor Levels — count_percent
code: levels= LETTERS[1:3] factor1 <- levels%>%sample(size = 10, replace = TRUE)%>%factor() count_percent(factor1,1) #> [1] "3 (30.0%)" "2 (20.0%)" "5 (50.0%)"

what: Print a styled table for HTML or LaTeX output — print_table
title: Print a styled table for HTML or LaTeX output — print_table
text: function prints styled table either HTML LaTeX format based output document type.

title: Print a styled table for HTML or LaTeX output — print_table
code: print_table(   df,   caption = "",   digits = 2,   print_rownames = FALSE,   fontsize = 9,   ... )

title: Print a styled table for HTML or LaTeX output — print_table
text: df data frame formatted table. caption caption table (default: ''). digits Number digits display (default: 2). print_rownames Logical indicating whether print row names (default: FALSE). fontsize Font size table (default: 9). ... Additional arguments passed formatting functions.

title: Print a styled table for HTML or LaTeX output — print_table
text: styled table either HTML LaTeX format.

title: Print a styled table for HTML or LaTeX output — print_table
code:
df <- data.frame(x = 1:5, y = letters[1:5]) print_table(df) #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #>
x y
1 a
2 b
3 c
4 d
5 e

Print a styled LaTeX table with alternating row colors — print_table_stripe
text: df data frame formatted table. fontsize Font size table (default: 7). stripe_color Color alternating row stripes (default: "cyan!15"). ... Additional arguments passed kbl function.

text: LaTeX table alternating row colors.

title: Print a styled LaTeX table with alternating row colors — print_table_stripe
code:
df <- data.frame(x = 1:5, y = letters[1:5]) print_table_stripe(df) #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #>
x y
1 a
2 b
3 c
4 d
5 e

title: Set default options for code chunks in R Markdown — rmd_opts_chunk_set
text: function determines output format (LaTeX HTML) sets appropriate chunk options. LaTeX output, sets options comment style, output width, figure settings, caching, code styling. HTML output, sets similar options tailored HTML rendering.

Format and style a table for LaTeX output — zkbl
text: table data table formatted. booktabs Logical indicating whether use booktabs formatting (default: TRUE). escape Logical indicating whether escape special characters table (default: TRUE). ... Additional arguments passed kbl function.

text: LaTeX-formatted table specified styling.

df <- data.frame(x = 1:5, y = letters[1:5]) zkbl(df) #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #>
x y

2 b

5 e
